column4: I would really appreciate your  help! with a little guidance on how to mount a password protected(alternative ubuntu cd) installed filesystem. My system wont startup and im using a usb key live disc now. Thank you!
-> you're booted of a usb disk?
yip. And I used ages for install encfs. I just can't find how to mount it :o
-> ages? what app is that?
on the usb rescue key
-> am not familiar with ages, what is it?
ages as years in time.
-> what happens when you mount it? what exactly is your mount command?
I tried lot of things with encfs, mount, fusemount. But encfs /dev/sda1 decryptedfolder/  tells me if I want to make the directory /dev/sda1. Im sure its just me there don't know the "right" command
-> am not familiar with encfs, but lets see what your mount command is like and lets see the system respnose (post in pastebin)
sure one moment - ps what pastebin do you want me to use?
here it is: http://paste.ubuntu.com/153513/  just tell me if you need anything else
-> i think you are missing options on your mount command, like the options for aes, -o loop and such,  google for the details on mounting encrypted file systems
I have tried for the last 3 hours to search for options, however without result. I've never used mount so I'm kinda a noobie.
I'm going to try reinstall ubuntu onto. And hope it wont screw it up even more. Thank you for your time. Kindly regards Martin
-> something like mount -o loop,encryption=aes,acl  /iso/or/partitiontomount    /mountpoint
thanks i'll try that
-> http://www.shell-tips.com/2008/07/13/using-losetup-and-dd-to-secure-sensitive-data-encrypted-block-device/
i'll have a look at it. However a start it actually ask me about a password: http://paste.ubuntu.com/153530/
-> you expect it to be right? you have an encrypted file system you want to mount?
yip, but I don'
yip, but I don't know which one. I used the guided encryption installation from the alternative ubuntu cd.
